thread.title: UK’s ‘oldest Iron Age gold' is revealed | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: UK’s ‘oldest Iron Age gold' is revealed | Daily Mail Online

author: Ellie Zolfagharifard For Mailonline
title: UK’s ‘oldest Iron Age gold' is revealed | Daily Mail Online
text: Britain's 'oldest Iron Age gold ever discovered' is found in a Staffordshire field by two treasure hunting friends Collection named the Leekfrith Iron Age Torcs and found in December Two treasure hunters found four torcs - three necklaces and one bracelet They were made in the third or fourth century BC, making them 2,500 years old They may have been buried for safekeeping or as an offering to the gods Lifelong friends who made the find had given up hunting treasure 20 years ago Published: 08:41 GMT, 28 February 2017 | Updated: 17:09 GMT, 28 February 2017 95 shares
